DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to determine if amiloride, a diuretic drug, is capable of increasing renal salt excretion, lowering blood pressure and inhibiting uPA in kidney transplant recipients with proteinuria compared to normoalbuminuric transplant patients.
DOC.brief_title: Increased Activity of ENaC in Proteinuric Kidney Transplant Recipients
DOC.criteria: One Group of kidney transplant recipients with ACR< 30mg/g One Group of kidney transplant recipients with ACR >300mg/g Negative pregnancy test at inclusion and taking contraceptive medication Receiving amiloride, glucocorticoids, aldosterone or spironolactone Clinically relevant organic or systemic disease including malignancy eGFR or creatininclearance < 30ml/min hyperkalemia (spotassium > 5,0mmol/l)
